description: From the genus name Salmonella, after its discoverer, Daniel Elmer Salmon.

entries.meaning: Any of the serotypes of the two species of rod-shaped bacteria, of the genus Salmonella, especially Salmonella enterica, that cause typhoid fever and salmonellosis, manifest as food poisoning and other diseases.
examples: Everyone got sick from salmonella in the undercooked meat.

entries.meaning: Food poisoning, especially in humans, caused by such organisms.
